Description: Rectangular sandstone stela of Akkendarpe; eight lines of Greek text.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Kalabsha, Erroneously attributed to Kalabsha, see Bierbrier 1994 and 1999. Confirms Nubia on internal evidence (after Junker 1925).
Curator's comments: See Bierbrier 1994. The Concordance Register and Birch Slip both assign this object the registration number 1843,0507.100, however in Register A1 this reg.no is matched with the big.no EA600. Acquisition details taken from the Catalogue.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1905 / Coptic and Greek Texts of the Christian Period from Ostraka, Stelae, etc. in the British Museum (p.10, pl.9)
Bierbrier 1994 / Provenances gained and lost (p.65-66, pl.11) (provenance not Kalabasha)
Synopsis 1848 / Synopsis of the Contents of the British Museum (p.192)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Arthur Lyttelton Annesley (according to Budge and Hall, but cf. Bierbrier 1994, 66.)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: I.Brit.Mus.Gr. I 9:6 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2006)
